title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 3.14 - Executive Order No. 14: Directing attendance of Attorney General at extraordinary special and trial term of the Supreme Court, Suffolk County
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 3.14 - Executive Order No. 14: Directing attendance of Attorney General at extraordinary special and trial term of the Supreme Court, Suffolk County

State Regulations
I. Pursuant to
article IV, section three of the Constitution of the State of New York, the
provisions of subdivision two of section
63
of the

Executive Law and the statutes and law in such case made and provided, and in
view of the request of the District Attorney of Suffolk County, Henry F. O'Brien, I hereby require that you, the Attorney General of this State, attend
in person, or by one or more of your assistants or deputies, an Extraordinary

Special and Trial Term of the Supreme Court to be appointed by me to be held in
and for the county of Suffolk at the County Court House and any other term or
terms of the Supreme Court in and for the County of Suffolk, and that you, in
person or by said assistants or deputies, appear before the grand jury drawn
for Said extraordinary term of said court, and before any grand jury or grand
juries which shall be drawn or which shall have heretofore been drawn for any
other term or terms of said court, for the purpose of managing and conducting
in said court and before said grand jury and said other grand juries any and
all proceedings, examinations and inquiries and any and all criminal actions
and proceedings which may be had or taken by or before said grand jury and
grand juries concerning or relating to: (a) any and all unlawful acts or omissions or alleged unlawful acts or omissions by

Eugene R. Kelley, Police Commissioner of Suffolk County; (b) any and all unlawful acts or omissions or
alleged unlawful acts or omissions by any officer, member or employee or former
officer, member or employee of the Suffolk County Police Department; (c) any and all unlawful acts or omissions or
alleged unlawful acts or omissions by Henry F. O'Brien, District Attorney of

Suffolk County; (d) any and all
unlawful acts or omissions or alleged unlawful acts or omissions by any
officer, member or employee or former officer, member or employee of the Office
of the District Attorney of Suffolk County; and that you conduct, manage, prosecute and handle such other proper actions and proceedings relating thereto
as may come before said court and that you conduct, manage, prosecute and
handle all trials at said extraordinary term of court or at any term of said
court at which any and all indictments which may be found and which may
hereafter be tried, pursuant to or in connection with this requirement, and in
the event of any appeal or appeals or other proceedings connected therewith, to
manage, prosecute, conduct and handle the same; and that in person or by your
assistants or deputies you, as of the date hereof, supersede and in the place
and stead of the District Attorney of the County of Suffolk exercise all the
powers and perform all the duties conferred upon you by the statutes and law in
such case made and provided and this requirement made hereunder; and that in
such proceedings and actions the District Attorney of the County of Suffolk
shall exercise only such powers and perform such duties as are required of him
by you or your assistants or deputies so attending. Pursuant to the provisions of subdivision two of section
63
of the

Executive Law, all expenses incurred by the Attorney General in relation to the
prosecution of the proceedings enumerated herein, including the salary or other
compensation of all deputies employed shall be a charge upon the County of

Suffolk. Signed: Hugh L. Carey

Dated: September 12, 1975

Executive Order No. 14.1
TO: THE HONORABLE LOUIS J. LEFKOWITZ ATTORNEY GENERAL OF
THE STATE OF NEW YORK STATE CAPITOL ALBANY, NEW YORK......................................................................................................................... Article I of the order and requirement upon you, embodied
in Executive Order Number fourteen and dated September twelfth, one thousand
nine hundred seventy-five, is hereby amended by adding thereto a new
subdivision (e) to read as follows: (e) any and all unlawful acts or omissions or
alleged unlawful acts or omissions by any person, which are in any way related
to any of the unlawful acts or omissions or alleged unlawful acts or omissions
specified in subdivisions (a), (b), (c), or (d); Signed: Hugh L. Carey

Dated: December 11, 1975

Executive Order No. 14.2
TO: THE HONORABLE LOUIS J. LEFKOWITZ ATTORNEY GENERAL OF
THE STATE OF NEW YORK STATE CAPITAL ALBANY, NEW YORK......................................................................................................................... Pursuant to Article IV, Section three, of the Constitution
of the State of New York, the provisions of subdivision two of Section
sixty three
of the

Executive Law and the statutes and law in such case made and provided, and in
view of the request of Henry F. O'Brien, the District Attorney of Suffolk

County, Article I of the order and requirement upon you, embodied in Executive

Order Number 14, dated the twelfth day of September, nineteen hundred
seventy-five, as amended by Executive Order Number 14.1, dated the eleventh day
of December, nineteen hundred seventy-five, is hereby further amended by adding
thereto a new subdivision (f), to read as follows: (f) any and all criminal offenses committed
by William F. O'Gorman, Jr., on or after the first day of March, nineteen
hundred seventy-three, and any and all criminal offenses in any way connected
or related thereto, except that this order and requirement shall not apply to
the following pending matters: People
v. Carmine Fatico, Louis

Caputo, William O'Gorman and Jerry Cowan, Indictment Numbers 373-73
and 493-73; People
v. William O'Gorman, Jr., Indictment Number 447-75; and

People
v. William O'Gorman, Jr., Suffolk County District Court, Docket Number 1075586; Signed: Hugh L. Carey

Dated: July 20, 1976

Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
ยง
3.14

comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
